intro: Lastrea calcarata, commonly known as the rock rose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of pink or purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Lastrea calcarata is well adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species.
